title: Tablighi Jamaat
summary: Tablighi Jamaat (lit. 'Society of Preachers',[5][6] also translated as "propagation party" or "preaching party")[2] is a transnational Sunni Islamic missionary movement[2][3][4] that focuses on exhorting Muslims and encouraging fellow members to return to practising their religion as per the Islamic prophet Muhammad,[7] particularly in matters of ritual, dress, and personal behaviour.[8][9] The organisation is estimated to have between 350 to 400 million adherents worldwide,[1] with the majority living in South Asia;[10][11] their presence is attested in 150 countries,[3][4] whereas other estimates attest an approximate number between 180[12] and 200 countries.[9] It has been deemed as "one of the most influential religious movements in 20th-century Islam."[13]
